intro: Medinilla surigaoensis, commonly known as the Surigao medinilla, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often found in lowland forests or along stream banks. Its flowers, which are usually pink or white, bloom in spring and summer, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
